title:
The existence of solutions for a Schrodinger equation with jumping
  nonlinearities crossing the essential spectrum
abstract:
In this paper, we establish the existence of one solution for a
Schr\"{o}dinger equation with jumping nonlinearities: $-\Delta u+V(x)u=f(x,u)$,
$x\in \mathbb {R}^N$, and $u(x)\to 0$, $|x|\to +\infty$, where $V$ is a
potential function on which we make hypotheses, and in particular allow $V$
which is unbounded below, and $f(x,u)=au^-+bu^++g(x,u)$. No restriction on $b$
is required, which implies that $f(x,s)s^{-1}$ may interfere with the essential
spectrum of $ -\Delta+V$ for $s\to +\infty$. Using the truncation method and
the Morse theory, we can compute critical groups of the corresponding
functional at zero and infinity, then prove the existence of one negative
solution.
